column4: Maybe FactTech or jcc1 can help us because they seem fairly familiar with Ubuntu.
repeat the question, I missed it
FactTech: Hi.  When I use "apt-cache search", I have to do some sort of index command before hand, right?  What was that command?  "apt-cache update" or something?
the packages themselves won't be there until you download them, just locations, versions, etc
Agreed that apt-cache won't download packages, but at least I should be able to locate a package name.
Have you tried to use Synaptic Package Manager yet?
that will update for you and give you various search options from a GUI
I'll try.  There are other packages that seem to be missing.  Anyway, for some reason Synaptic (and Compiz) have teensy font sizes (size 7) that I can't read.
I don't use Compiz so I cannot help you there
(separate issue now --I have *lots* of problems with Ubuntu) I can't read the fonts so I have to use the command-line instead.
Compiz has always been a pain the few times I tried it, so I always dumped it, I'm not big on eye candy anyway :-)
I need it for the magnifier function, so I can read the screen properly.
If it were me, I would just dump Compiz

What screen magnifier would you recommend if not the one in Compiz, that would work with Kubuntu (KDE3)?  I tried KMag but it takes too much clicking.  I want one that appears when I need it and disappears when I don't need it.

What screen magnifier would you recommend if not the one in Compiz, that would work with Kubuntu (KDE3)?  I tried KMag but it takes too much clicking.  I want one that appears when I need it and disappears when I don't need it.
sorry, I was on the phone... I rarely use 'em so I don't have a good anser
